sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
Fyve homiles of late, made by a ryght good and vertuous clerke, called master Leonarde Pollarde, prebendary of the Cathedrall Churche of Woster, directed and dedicated to the ryght reuerende Father in God Rychard by the permissyon of God bysshoppe of Woster his specyall good Lorde. Vewed, examined, and alowed by the right reuerende Father in God Edmonde byshop of London, within whose diocese they are imprinted. Cum priuilegio ad imprimendum solum Pollard, Leonard, d. 1556.
[94] p.
In Ftetestrete [sic] at the signe of the Faucon ageynst saynt Dunstones Church by VVyllyam Gryffyth, and are to be solde at his shop a lyttle aboue the Condyte at the signe of the Gryffin], [Imprinted at London : Anno. M.D.LVI. [1556]
Imprint from colophon. Contains same initials as STC 3375 and may have been printed by William Powell--STC. Leaf C2 cancelled by 10 leaves in gatherings of 4, 4, and 2; the first leaves of each gathering are signed C2, C3 and C4 respectively--NUC. Signatures: A-B⁴ C⁴(-C2, +C2⁴, C3⁴, and C4² ) D-K⁴ (K4 blank). Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
=======
Fyve homiles of late, made by a ryght good and vertuous clerke, called master Leonarde Pollarde, prebendary of the Cathedrall Churche of Woster, directed and dedicated to the ryght reuerende Father in God Rychard by the permissyon of God bysshoppe of Woster his specyall good Lorde. Vewed, examined, and alowed by the right reuerende Father in God Edmonde byshop of London, within whose diocese they are imprinted. Cum priuilegio ad imprimendum solum Pollard, Leonard, d. 1556.
[94] p.
In Ftetestrete [sic] at the signe of the Faucon ageynst saynt Dunstones Church by VVyllyam Gryffyth, and are to be solde at his shop a lyttle aboue the Condyte at the signe of the Gryffin], [Imprinted at London : Anno. M.D.LVI. [1556]
Imprint from colophon. Contains same initials as STC 3375 and may have been printed by William Powell--STC. Leaf C2 cancelled by 10 leaves in gatherings of 4, 4, and 2; the first leaves of each gathering are signed C2, C3 and C4 respectively--NUC. Signatures: A-B⁴ C⁴(-C2, +C2⁴, C3⁴, and C4² ) D-K⁴ (K4 blank). Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
VVyllyam Gryffyth
his shop a lyttle aboue the Condyte at the signe of the Gryffin]
the signe of the Faucon ageynst saynt Dunstones Church
>>>>>>> imprintparse
